Posts.Content: Deedee79 wrote: Hi all, I had a lumpectomy and had 19 lymph nodes removed a month ago. Thank God, no cancer in the lymph nodes. I have been crocheting and I'm beginning to think it's the wrong thing to do. My arm is starting to really hurt and I noticed that I have a little swelling around my elbow. My upper arm hurts when I try to reach for things. The answer must be *stop doing those things"! I wonder how long it will be before I can crochet again, if ever? Any crocheters or knitters out there? Thanks, Dee Deedee78 Dx 7/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage II, Grade 3, 0/19 nodes, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

I know my surgeon said she'd refer me to a therapist if I had problems. I thank you so much, as I now realize I'm not giving me a chance to heal. Hugs,Deedee

Posts.Title: 4 nodes removed - lymphedema risk? BustersMom Deedee79

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2008 09:36PM Deedee79 wrote: Hi all! I'm confused! I had a lumpectomy a week ago. Had the drain removed two days ago. Seem to be doing fine except for some numbness in the left arm where they operated. I had 19 lymph nodes removed, but they were'nt under my arm, because I have no incision there. I just have the one incision. Maybe these are'nt sentinel nodes. They were'nt able to get a good reading on my xray. Took 10 pictures. Said the mass I had was blocking the picture. No one has said anything about lymphedema. This is the first I've heard of it. Maybe like so many, my case is different? This sight is interesting and informative.    Deedee PS : the nodes where clear
